reviews.text: I’m from Thailand and I ordered multiple entrees all of them lived up to my expectation. I recommend this place if you looking for authentic Thai food. I will be back here to try other dishes on their menu soon.💓💕

Best fried rice and pad Thai in Virginia!
The owner is so sweet and all servers are nice and attentive! We always enjoys dinning in or take out from Thai Cafe!
Wow! I'm so happy they have a Thai menu. Tried Tum Sau Talay and it was amazing! On point!! for any Thais who missed some country Thai cooking. Definitely will go back and tried the rest of the menu.
I had lunch with my husband, and the food, service, and portions were perfect. What more could you ask for?

The customer service is awesome! We came on Valentines Day, and it was my husbands first time trying Thai food and was inexperienced with the spice level. They saw and remade his food with a lighter spice level! They are amazing! 10/10 recommend! The food was delicious too!

Great place for comfort food, especially on a cold, rainy day.  My friend got the combo salad and chili.  I got the Ribeye Philly Steak on a sweet potato sub roll.  The side of honey pepper relish was something different and really good.  Looks like a real, old fashioned diner like the one I knew as a teenager.  Now, I appreciate the ten percent discount for seniors.

I had the lemony hummus with cauliflower pita bread and it was delicious. The sweet potato fries are very good too. The serving sizes are smaller than at other restaurants. I definitely felt like I could eat some more after I finished my meal. Also it's a little pricey for the small serving size. The hummus pita dish was around $16 I think. For that amount of money I want a good filling meal that doesn't leave me still feeling hungry. But if you don't want large portion sizes this might be a good restaurant for you.

I went at lunch time on a Friday and it was very busy, the parking lot was very full and I had to park far from the restaurant. However there was no line or wait time so that was great. It did take awhile for our food to be prepared. Maybe 20 or 30 minutes. The staff were polite but seemed harried and overwhelmed due to the busyness. They did get our orders correct, so that was good. I wasn't sure with how distracted our waiter was what we'd end up getting. Overall a good experience. My main complaints are the small serving size for the price and I didn't like the crowded, busy atmosphere and the long wait for the food.

Overall I liked the restaurant. It was better then I expected it to be. My wife loved her milkshake and I really liked my bison burger. I think the portions were a small for the price. And took a while before the food came out.

This retro diner chain gives you the GOOD TIME vibes as soon as you walk in. You can’t miss the jukebox and the checkered black and white floors to get you in at 1950s mindset. I thought the Fonz was coming out of the back at any moment.

Great selection of food for breakfast lunch or dinner. I had the avocado toast and it was delightful. I

Always a good time here. Family and children friendly. Competent, friendly service. Great kids menu. Comparatively good prices and great food! Love my Luau burger!
Also, their booths are partitioned nicely with the glass dividers that go up pretty high. Overall good experience 👍
The complementary bread taste delicious, our waiter was really nice and she also mentioned the Tuesday pizza specials, All  the food that we ordered taste good and it came out really fast.
I had a pretty decent experience here. No wait, food serving were fairly large for the price. Service was okay, but overall I’d be willing to give this place another go.

Bertucci's restaurant is one of the most terrible experience that I had in a restaurant. Please, avoid a bad time and waste your money over there.
I arrived 8:15pm, and the place is closing at 9:30pm. My wife and I ordered simple food: Bertucci's platter as starter ( 4 chicken wings, 2 garlic bread, 2 meatball, 2 grilled cheese), 1 lasagna, and 1 chicken Parmigiano. The garlic bread was not fresh made today, the consistency indicated it was made a day ago as sooner. The lasagna supposed made in a brick oven came totally cold in the center. This issue happened when you change the brick oven by microwave. The waitress was so nice, and that disaster was not her fault. She tried to fix the issue, and offered me a new lasagna whole the clock shows 9:00 pm. I said please don't, but she insisted. Well, there is the picture of the same plate that she brought. I guess the chef put more cheese on top, and place into the brick oven until burn it.
I never will back to that place where the only 2 good thing was de waitress service and the salad for US$88.00 (inc. Tip).
Sadly, here is not option less than 1 star because they broke a record for bad quality food.
Overall good value and excellent food and service. Ever since they went to an uptown image and stopped playing Italian tunes, the ambiance isn't the same and kind of sucks at times.

We have ordered from Bertucci’s a dozen times and always enjoyed the food. Tonight was a different story- and so bad that we will likely never return. TLDR: it took 3 hours to get our order and the pizza was inedible. See photo. Order at your own risk.

We ordered through Grubhub and our order was delayed multiple times. My husband called to check in and they said it would not take as long as Grubhub was estimating and that they were just behind because of their BOGO pizza deal on Tuesdays. BOGO pizza deal? Uhhh well we paid full price through Grubhub. The manager was shocked to learn the discount doesn’t show up for Grubhub customers. First issue. My husband very politely explained how long we’ve been waiting and we were offered a future free pizza. Fine.

More delays later our order is randomly cancelled via Grubhub. My husband calls again. They are shocked to learn the order was cancelled… not sure how that works but ok… so they tell him the pizzas just came out of the oven and they will give them to us for free if I want to come get it. Fine. Off I go to pick it up.

I show up at the restaurant, which was empty by the way, except for a few people waiting for takeout. Come to find out our order is NOT ready. There was no presence from the manager. He came around to put some things into the POS system and never acknowledged any of the weary customers who had been waiting for hours. Never apologized, and never even appeared to have any sense of urgency to get the restaurant back on track.

Finally the pizza was done and it was absolutely disgusting. The dough was practically uncooked yet the cheese was burned. We threw it away. After over 3 hours of waiting, we were left hungry.

If a pizza restaurant can’t manage to make pizzas- the literal bare minimum- what else isn’t being managed there? Are the employees washing their hands? Makes you wonder. We’re so turned off by the ridiculous wait, poor food quality and lack of management intervention that we will likely not return. It’s very disappointing because we previously loved it. But this experience was beyond ridiculous.

There were 2 signs outside and online states that the store is open until 10:00. After flying in internationally, we wanted to get a quick bite to eat to bring home with us. We pulled up at 9:35 and the woman behind the counter told us that they were closed.
Clean and they make a solid sandwic. Usually avoid Subway altogether but have ordered employees lunch from here several times and always well done. Don't skip them.

Not the best location on the planet, this location gets the job done during peak hours like lunch but not during other hours. Just walked to this location at 9:30pm (Close at 10pm) for a sub afterwork and was turned away. If I can work 16 hour days, you can stay open until the posted time.

reviews.author_name: Ay Yo Cuzz Ay Yo Sann
reviews.text: The server didnt say a word. He just stared out the window and just stretched his arms. Like he just woke up or something. He just looked like he didn't want to even work there. He just expected me to know what he was thinking, without even speaking. No greeting, not asking even what kind of bread I want etc. I'm just here waiting for him to just serve me. But he just had a look of disgust on his face. Not very very good at all
Does not accept coupons very bad experience and customer service.

Friday lunch visit. Plenty of parking, no crowd. Traffic heavy. Easy to see from the road. Immediately seated. Eclectic American menu. A lot of interesting lunch combos. Soups came immediately and were hot and tasty. Sandwiches came shortly after. Very nice sandwiches. Tasty. Large.
Totally enjoyed lunch.

This Chili's location was great! I was visiting from Manassas and decided to stop in. Same great for, same great atmosphere. This location has a very good feel to it, with the warning rays of sun setting a good mood coming thru the front doors. The only gripes I could come up with were that the table was a bit dirty, and that the area from the parking lot to the inside has a door but it wasn't the front door....?? This is a apparently a mobile order To-Go door. It really throws off the look of the restaurant when the first door that guests can walk up to isn't the front door... But, I guess there's nothing the restaurant staff or managers can do about that, haha! That's an architect and engineer's thing. Overall the service was great. I ordered the chicken enchilada soup to start (no tortilla strips), and original chicken crispers as a main. They were both cooked well, and perfect. My server continually checked in on me and wasn't the talkative type. He let me say what I needed and left it simple, which I appreciated very much. He brought me a couple things when I asked for them and was always there to help at the right time. What I did find odd was that the person bringing me my food was not the person checking on me or taking my order. All in all, a great ending to the day for me. Thanks Chili's crew!
Ordered classic nachos with beef and thought I got nothing—there were mor hidden under aluminum foil! Make sure you look!!! Also ordered Southwest Egg Rolls. Great food for Super Bowl Sunday!!!

Great experience & great service! I ordered my food (Boneless Buffalo Wings, Southwestern Eggrolls, & Chicken Tenders) through the Chili’s app and picked it up at the to go window. The guys were super polite & professional. My food was hot & neatly packaged. Great service, great food!

Was pleasantly surprised about prices.   We are trying not to go to Glory Days as much since they have been increasing their prices too frequently.  The "feel" of this place was nice and open and bright.  I will be back.

Service was decent, but the food was not. I get this same meal every time and have never been disappointed with it until this time. These are two different plates with the same meal and both look disgusting and was disgusting. They skimped on the food, the mashed potatoes were dry and bland, the chicken was bland with a slice of Kraft cheese. Only thing decent was the shrimp. The utensils were all dirty too. Every single one of them.

Only 3 stars because the size of the steak and the salmon was just RIDICULOUS! Other con is the music. It’s too loud to be a restaurant! But the food is good and the staff is very friendly! Steve was the best!

Portion size is lacking lately. I ordered via GrubHub and when the order arrived I was shocked!!! $15 appetizer came back with literally 7 nuggets. Called the restaurant and spoke to Rachel who offered for me to call Grub Hub for a refund, or to go pick up a remade order. Glad she offered something (hence the 2 stars,) but I wasn't going to drive there when that defeats the whole purpose of ordering delivery. Had they MADE IT RIGHT THE FIRST TIME, I wouldn't have needed to call and address.

The worst food I have ever tasted.  We arrived at 9:00 pm, it was still 9:45 and the food had not arrived, calculating that the place was half empty.  I ordered a spinach dip appetizer and my appetizer only came with chips and red sauce, where's my dip?  My main plate was some fajitas with rice, and they let the rice and the sirloin fajita burn with a sweet sauce that didn't even come off the plate because it was so burnt.Totally  disappointed

I should have read other reviews before choosing this place for lunch. In the time I've been here, about 55 minutes after ordering, I've watched two families give up on waiting for their food and leave, both of which were seated after me. It can't be a staffing shortage, there are at least three servers, one host, and one bartender. I'm sure there's a manager hiding somewhere in this building. Not counting the patrons at the bar, who are all eating and none of them were here when I arrived, there were only seven tables taken. Most have two patrons, a few have three.

One hour ten minures later (after seating) I'm asked if I'm still waiting on my food.

A few minutes later my order arrives. The food was ok, not worth the wait if I knew it would turn out like this.

As I'm walking out one of the servers is turning away customers before they make it in the door. As one of them mentioned, "Its weird, it's like they're happy about it." It's just after 1:30 in the afternoon and they're turning away customers.

Whoever ordered food from there online between 1:00  and 1:30, your delivery driver was sent away empty-handed.

I've long since made the decision to avoid chain restaurants like this based on routinely poor service and marginal quality food. This just reinforced that decision.

Very nice experience of dining, you can either order from the menu or make your own mix from the variety of ingredients including different types of pork, beef, chicken, bacon,  sausage, sea foods, etc. Then you have the vegetables, seasonings, and sauces. You can fill you chosen bowl size as much as you can, then take it to the chef who will grill them and bring them to your table.

The Mangolian grill 😋My friend suggested this place and we visited here for the first time. We get the bowls (there are sizes for the bowl) and we get to choose our meat, sides (including the salt, pepper and the sauces etc. Make sure the salt & spices are correct 😅). After adding everything, you move to the kitchen area where the chefs ask your preferred base (rice/noodles etc) and after our selection, they cook it for us based on the ingredients we give.

It’s a different kind of experience and we liked it. I suggest you go for the regular bowl because the food you get would be sufficient. By looking at the size of the regular bowl for adding the ingredients, we got the large bowl. Later we realised its a big mistake.

I’ve always wanted to come here since I was a kid and decided to finally take the chance since we had to go to Amazon fresh next door. Upon entering I expected it to be like hands-on chipotle style where you just create what you want, not a sit-down dining experience which is fine. We came around noon and were sat down immediately but no one came to our table for at least 10 minutes. Since we’ve never been there we walked over to the bar and the host stopped us and sat us back down and started taking our order instead of a waiter. We placed our order and got our food, but it annoyed us that no waiter came to help and the host had to. The food itself is decent, the sauces were too sweet for me personally but my girlfriend enjoyed it which is what really matters. Overall I probably won’t go back unless I’m really in the mood or opt for takeout.

It's one of my favorite restaurants, but last night 12/26/2022 was disgusting.  I live 40min away and I went to find a dirty restaurant, without food and when I asked for food the employee Alex told me that's what we have, will you want your food?  And I 😳😱 was able to take some photos

That Was ROUGH!

FOOD:

Sadly, we couldn't finish the food.  We chose steak tips, carne asada,  something like fried rice, and noodles.

The meat was not chewable.  The rice wasn't cooked well and the end product was very oily.

The fresh meat was hard to chew. We had to stop chewing and put in the napkin.

The rice was very hard, not even close to al'dente.

The only thing good were the fried chicken dumplings. They call them Potstickers.

SERVICE:

Our server was very professional. BUT, she was alone greeting you, sitting you, instructing on how to do things, taking orders and delivering food. A modern day wonder woman!

In my opinion bad management!

BATHROOMS

TRIPLE DANG!  Men's bathroom smelled horrible!  So I asked my partner to check the women's bathroom and she indicated that it was not clean.

Maybe due to something someone ate?

SUMMARY:

In my opinion, this a place to never return. We didn't finish our plates and the food was so rough we didn't even ask for boxes to bring the food home.

RETURN FACTOR
0%

RECOMMEND A FRIEND FACTOR
0%

I usually order from here, there should always be at least 3 people working because I’ve noticed it’s a popular location no matter day or time of the week it is. I pre-ordered through the app & asked for 2 scoops of strawberries and got nothing but the strawberry juice with lemonade.. I was trying to get their attention but they were so busy it was difficult. 2 people working there isn’t enough, had to wait an extra 10+ minutes for my baked good. Just put more people on the floor.

I just left this starbucks (which is normally 5 starts anyway) and the young man working the cashier on Wednesday at 3pm was so kind and accommodating for my mother's birthday.  I had gone to several other Starbucks before coming to Springfield looking for a specific item my mother loves and he went out of his way to help me out.
This is my preferred SB and I go out of my way to go there.  They roll a mean Dark Roast all day and they have some really awesome staff.  The manager runs a tight ship.

Just another Starbucks. Nothing special or outstanding about this store.  Everything for us was as expected. Good drinks, snacks, and customer service. The seating and atmosphere lacked in my opinion. The store was kind of blah.

The overall experience was extremely disappointing.  First, when I got my drinks they were not made right.  I got a caramel frappachino with 7 pumps of caramel syrup.  The problem was they added little to no caramel syrup at all.  It tasted like ice and coffee.  Next, when we came back to get them remade, they took well over 15 min to remake the two drinks.  I would give them one give m two because at least they remade them for me.

So many good things on the menu.  The French Toast Combo with bacon , scrambled eggs and hash browns was perfect for me.  My friends chose the Blueberry Pancakes with bacon strips and the Bacon Temptation Omelette with pancakes.  Service was great.  We all left happy.

The omelette used to be better, and the presentation of the milkshake was a mess, so I had to request the waitress to get a clean glass. I couldn't touch it without getting sticky fingers. Fortunately, I got a better one.

Nice place.  We were seated immediately even though it was very busy.  Great Service our waitress came right over to the table and took our drink order first.  Was back with our drinks and she took our order. Food came out and we had no complaints.
Everything was good.
The only thing there was and it's not their fault.  Is people letting there little kids run around while you're trying to eat. Screaming and yelling!! That was the most unpleasant thing of our day.  If you're going to bring your kids out have them under control.  It's not a playground...it's a restaurant.  Its the parents fault they should have brought something for them to do to keep them occupied for a while.  Little toys, coloring books, etc.  But otherwise a good time.
I would definitely recommend going back again.
Great place to stop for a quick breakfast... It was crowded but that is no surprise on a Sunday morning. We were able to get right in which is always appreciated. Service was fast and food was good.
Very clean and highly efficient service. Great interplay between servers and kitchen staff. I enjoyed the deliciously prepared protein pancakes with strawberries and bananas.

This Chick-Fil-A has an excellent service, just like in all other branches I and my family visited. Satisfying services satiates your stomach. I’m my travels, a quick turn to any Chick-fil-A is always a pleasure. Superlicious always!!!

Their service for delivery orders is awful, going to the restaurant yourself is usually fine. They will always forget sauce/condiments. Also the chicken biscuits for breakfast are a joke with subpar chicken and biscuits that fall apart immediately.
No line today.  Had a spicy chicken sandwich and fries.  Very quick food as always. Love the waffle fries.  ☆☆☆ 1/2 stars.

Heading up north and needed to stop and get some food. Did the drive-through. The food was fresh hot and correct. Very good staple when comes to what you expect it to be. The staff had smiles and were very polite. Take notes restaurant you may just increase your business

I got the animated dude in the drive thru, it’s fine if you aren’t hungry hungry, it’s annoying when you are on the verge of your first world hunger.

He also was not aware that this location is trying out the crispy fries, I don’t like those but he said they still had the regular ones (false) so I ordered a meal. Pretty disappointing to get the crispy ones. The sweet tea also was lacking sweetness. The nuggets and frozen lemonade with ice dream were good.

Doubt I would return if I was in the area again.

Where has this wonderful little gem been for the last few years? Sadly, this has not been on our radar until now. We had this on our list of places to try and luckily came during restaurant week. It’s tucked into an office building, and you would not think that the food, the atmosphere, the service, or the creative menu would shine like it does. We did arrived a little early and then sat at the bar for their happy hour on Sunday. Well worth it! Then we chose from the restaurant week menu, which was excellent! My husband is a chef, so it’s pretty hard to go out and eat and really enjoy our meal without it being deconstructed, and he loved every bite. We are very excited to return, and bring our friends!

We found this place by chance when we were looking for somewhere to have a fake Valentine’s Day dinner near Springfield Town Center. The food was so good I couldn’t stop eating it. It was also incredibly affordable for how good it was. We will definitely be making this a regular place to eat for special occasions.

Don’t be deterred by the location. We thought we had the wrong address but it is actually on the ground floor of an office building on a side road by the medical center. We parked in the parking garage of the office building and walked around. I thought it was a little sketchy but the place was very nice on the inside.

We have been before and it was better last time. The time in which servers came by was for the first timw not enough. We decided to do Happy hour  - though we ordered plenty to ensure a good tip, the servers were not attentive.
The food was really good! The only negative food experience was they over cooked the zucchini chips. Otherwise it was great! We plan on going back sometime in the future for dinner. The environment was nice, and the drinks were well made.

Cousin date with my best girl this evening! We dropped in for happy hour and a great time. This place was recommended to us by our aesthetician DeeDee (shameless plug: Acuzar Sugaring in Springfield, VA)! So so glad she did.

EVERYTHING was superb!! Happy hour has select drinks and appetizers for lower prices that vary. We ordered Prosecco, a margarita and a lemon drop. The margarita and martini were made really well. Martinis are always a toss up for me because I expect them to be super strong or too sweet but it was a perfect balance. I wish I could’ve ordered more!

The mussels (we got the garlic and white wine sauce) were really good. I love a good broth. Calamari was crisp to perfection! The flat bread almost looked like a pizza but surprisingly did not resemble one in taste. It was.. delicate for a lack of better words! The meatball sliders?? Haven’t had one better. The bun was soft and the meatball was light in texture. Definitely going back for more of those.

So many options on the menu that we wanted to try but made a pact we’d come back. We settled for the cheese wheel experience, with a recommendation from our bartender. And it did not disappoint. The fettuccine was so rich and creamy, and like another review I read stated, didn’t need any extra seasoning! We were kinda full from all the apps so we couldn’t finish our pasta but I can’t wait to finish it! Definitely check these guys out. Our check said our bartender was Young C. Please pass along our compliments! We’ll be returning soon.

Nice environment but the service sucked to be honest. We waited 20 minutes for bread. I had a spaghetti carbonara special and it was full of bacon fat and the noodles were undercooked. The chocolate cake was gross. It tasted stale honestly. The food looked good but tasted meh.

My wife and I recently moved to the area. We had heard good things about Delia’s so we decided to take a walk over to check out the restaurant. We started with a gyro as an appetizer. (Unconventional, I know 😀). Our waiter, Nick, was great and cut the gyro in half and gave it to us on two separate plates. We ordered the 12 inch Hawaiian pizza as our meal. It was really tasty 😋. So was the gyro. It was a lot of food and we were able to take a few slices home with us. We finished off the meal with a slice of cheesecake. The portion was very generous. What a great meal! Nick was an amazing server. 5 star dining experience!

Tons of free surface parking. Reasonable prices.  Entered & waited a few minutes to be seated per the sign, only to be told to seat ourselves. Once seated, service was timely & attentive. I was craving gyro & this was one of the best gyro sandwiches I've had!

Prices are reasonable and I mainly go for the breakfast. I like Delia’s more than the corporate breakfast chains because I don’t have to deal with the crowds and long wait for a table. Today’s order was the Delia’s breakfast with eggs over easy, ham, home fries, white toast, and a side of grits. Second order was 3 pancake breakfast supreme with home fries, scrambled eggs, and ham. Going to need a doggie bag.

We ordered two large Greek salads, one with chicken.  They were fresh and absolutely delicious.  The lettuce was crisp and the tomatoes were bright red and flavorful.  The real star though is the house dressing!

The pizza is also great but those salads are amazingggg!!
The wings were crispy and well done, a bit more sauce and it would have been perfect. The portions were big !

Absolutely one of the worst Dunkins I've been to in the DMV area. I'm not certain if Sumaiya hates her job or was just having a bag day, but it was apparent she didn't want to help me with my transaction. I wasn't greeted, smiled at, thanked and was barely spoken to by this young lady. I  work 5 days a week for  a transportation company that serves the entire DMV area, and I travel to various Dunkin Donuts daily while working. I've been to over 50 Dunkin's in the last 6 months alone, forget the last few years. This one almost takes the cake for the worst customer service, because it's usually phenomenal. I don't like writing bad reviews but I felt so bad after leaving this Dunkin'!

The only thing good about this experience was the green tea which was perfect. I'll try my luck next time with lower expectations.

When they decide to open, it's pretty good.  However don't be fooled by the sign stating they are open at 5 am.  There might be a person inside, but that doesn't mean the doors are unlocked.  I watched until 5:15 and at least 3 people, other than myself, tried to stop for breakfast/coffee and left.  Business must be good to ignore the early morning customers on their way to work.
Servers are always pleasant.  Coffee is good value. Surprisingly, the espresso is pretty decent.

Awful experience. Poor customer service, the lady had an attitude when I was telling her what donuts I wanted , she seemed very inpatient, the donuts I ordered were so stale, I threw them away…. This dunkin donuts should be shut down by the health department, it was kept very unclean and the quality of the food, I wouldn’t even feed it to my dog.

Poor employee training and operation. I usually think twice about making a review like this because I don't know if the reprucssions cen be too harsh on employees, but the person at the register didn't seem to know anything.

It was obvious that the training was either subpar or nonexistent.

I asked for a dozen glazed, and only afterwards I was told that there was no glazed, no big deal. The issue comes when I ask politely for a refund and was basically told no, I have never ever been to a place that was incapable of a refund, im almost certain the employee was not trained properly on how to handle the register.

I didn't bother arguing because getting different flavored donuts is better than spending time arguing with what seems to be the only employee in the store who can't issue a refund.

I had also ordered a strawberry coolatta and got a completely different drink, it still looked good despite being a completely different drink so I didn't even bother arguing.

Just go to a different donut shop.

I ask the employee politely if I can use the restroom. She said no’. Must be own by a nasty franchise who has directed to his employees  not to let it happen. I spent a good amount of money with subway every year and I am myself own multiple businesses. I have never let that happen in my businesses.  If someone not buying anything now, they will buy something later. This guys need to be a little more open minded to the customer. This is not even a bad area, most of the people here are professionals.

It is inappropriate for an associate to be on the phone when a customer walks in. I was greeted and he continued to use the phone in the food preparation area. I decided to wait and see if he would follow customer service etiquette and put the phone away, he only did so after after I appeared to walk near to look at the menu. As I began to order, the associate then grabbed gloves with his dirty hands that were just using the cell phone. I then proceeded to ask him to wash his hands and he simply ran water on his hands for 5 seconds and put the same contaminated gloves on. I walked out of the store at this point. Management, please retrain your staff to follow proper hand washing procedures and the importance of reducing the risk of communicable diseases due to poor sanitation practices. I will not return and will purchase food at chic fil a.

Wanted a pizza and there was 1 person behind me. There was 1 person working. He took the pizza and put it in the oven and didnt ask me if I wanted any toppings and started asking the customer behind me what they wanted. At that point the pizza got warm and well I didnt want a cheese pizza.

This is by far the best Subway in the DMV area.  I have tried three (3) closer to where I live, one downtown DC and have had Subway catered multiple times downtown DC. The quality and availability of food items is far above other neighboring Subways as is the service, cleanliness of the location and team members actually add veggies to fill the sandwich instead of the others who count the lettuce strands, pickles and tomato slices such that the sandwich looks anorexic. Not here. The only word of warning is that this location is near a Chick-fil-A that has a VERY faithful following where it can be difficult to get in and out of the shopping center, even if you park on the opposite end from Subway.
This subway is a hit or miss. Sometimes it’s good, other times it’s awful. They need to switch the bread because it’s super stale.

THIS IS THE WORST LOCATION EVER ! I never experience this at other pizza hut’s. I called and placed an order over the phone. The lady told me 15mins . I arrive 30mins later to give them extra time. She tells me she didn’t get my order my call must have went to the call center. The lady has an accent and that’s the same lady who took my order down. They need a whole new staff because they are messing up peoples orders. The lady lied to me and told me they don’t have a phone number the number goes to the call center . That doesn’t even make any sense.

Customer service is horrible, pizza is almost always raw along with other things such as wings. Sounds like a lawsuit to me. Samiyah in particular hung up on me multiple times, refused to give me managers name, then claimed he was on vacation and finally hung up on me. She told me that I was wasting her time because I asked for a replacement, she told me that I would then also have to return the other pizza (which I was going to!). Then she claimed I am doing this for a free pizza.... which is extremely rude and odd to say to someone. Samiyah refused to send me replacement or help me with store credit. she then claimed it is raw due to the fact that I added 3 additional toppings... again, odd. This is not the first time this has happened at this particular branch either. I emphasized to cook it fully when placing the order yet they still sent me a raw meal. with chicken might I add, its like they want their customers to get salmonella. It is also about a 5 minute walk from me yet delivery takes over 40 mins. Will not be supporting this business again, time to take my business elsewhere.

Called in my order ahead of time.  Still had to stand and wait for my order.  Salads weren't included and had to get refunded for one of them.  The older caucasian woman was passive aggressive as she kept putting down my receipt instead of simply placing it in my hand as  I was patiently holding out for her to politely do so.  She rambled about the cook not showing up however what does this have to do with plain curtesy.  Since she was prepping food in the back let's hope she washed her hands when she returned from the register as there were no gloves being used.

Would give 0 stars if it was an option. My husband went to go pick up our online order and after sitting in there for a while they said their oven just broke 5 minutes ago when the pizza was supposed to be ready. They obviously hadn’t made the pizza in a timely manner and didn’t let him know there was an issue until he asked after the order. Should have gone to papa John’s.

Pizza was decent.  However, we ordered boneless wings from here which were completely raw on the inside.  I ended up eating two before realizing because I was dunking them in sauce.  The texture/taste were off so I decided to take a look.  Like I said...completely raw....
The restaurant refunded the money for the wings but it doesn't help that I ate two of them beforehand.

Delivery order. Quick, Delicious, Hot. I am writing this because the food on my table now is the BEST chinese food I've found. Since I moved to VA last month, I've tried dozens of delivery orders from different restaurants 5 miles around, and Great Wall has the most delicious food. The Tofu is very flavorful, and Shrimp Lo Mein is excellent also. I always have work too late and get hungry, the delicious food with an extra egg roll, fried rice are really fantastic.
We really enjoyed this place. The lunch specials were good. Food tasted good. Service was great. I would definitely recommend this place.
13.95 I got a delicious General Tso’s chicken White meat!!, Side fried rice for free!  Clean and tidy restaurant with fast food delivery!  highly recommended!  !

SIMPLY AMAZING FOOD! I have eaten here for years. Food is great, atmosphere is great and so are the people. One of my favorite dishes is the beef and broccoli. If you’re ever on this side of town step in and get you a to go lunch or dinner. Heck get both, you won’t be disappointed. I promise ☺️
The food is great and lots of it, it’s very clean and people are nice , I will return there  for sure .

I love Houlihan's the chile Tai wings are my favorite also the parmesan frites! Never have to wait to be seated, service is somewhat slow but I'm guessing its because it is attached to the Hilton hotel. The bathrooms are very clean and tables are always cleaned.

Leaving only one star because can't find a way to not leave a star. All I can say is if u are one of those people who order online, like through Express entree, do not expect your order on time, if they are busy at the restaurant they will leave those online orders to the very end, I was there 2 days ago and they kept me waiting for ONE HOUR after the estimated pick up time, the Hispanic manager definitely can't perform that job properly, after that hour they didn't even have my food, the order was cancelled after they wasted my time. smfh
The fish tacos were outstanding recommend by our waiter wasn't too busy nice adult atmosphere

It was overall okay. The food was delicious and it was a very nice restaurant for being in a Hilton Hotel. However, the chef line was reported to be very backed up with incoming orders. And my family and I couldn't be seated until four minutes after we arrived by our waiter. So, that is why I gave it a four star rating. I feel comfortable going back there though if I had to.
I love the happy hour and appetizers at Houlihan's. The tuna is the BEST!!!
I like the cheesesteak at Charleys.  Very good.   The bread is soft.  The steak is good.  Charley's is one of my favorite go to food court sub places.  ☆☆☆☆ Will go again.

I go to Charley's a lot in different cities.. and this is the worst I've ever seen my sandwich prepared.. the bread is over toasted and somehow soggyat the same time as well as ripped, the meat is stuck to the box and has paper attached to it now and they were skimpy with the mushrooms, onions, and green peppers

Basic mall-quality food.  Nothing spectacular, but I ate every bite with no regret which is always a good thing.  I will say, I did not like the uncooked veggies added to my sandwich.  I usually prefer sauteed peppers etc., not cold ingredients added.  I actually really hate that.  Great Steak is an example of a restaurant that sautees then adds the veggies to the sandwich - MUCH better option for me.  Charley's does offer specialty beverages (lemonades), but I did not get one, but will next time I go here.
I love Philly cheesesteak sandwiches.  Philadelphia PA is the best place to get them.  This is a shopping mall food court location.  It's good and is a good challenge for the other vendors.
The chicken California and Philly cheesesteak is so delicious! Yummy drinks as well. 10/10.

A complete rip off. I ordered the wok fried shrimp for my daughter in a cub meal and they only give you 3 shrimp. But so much rice that a child can’t eat. Let alone you don’t even have enough of the entree item to eat with the rice. And they charge .75 extra cents for a premium entree.

- service is ok

- friendly management

- food never seems to be that fresh when I go

- don't use a gift card, they will say it's not working. It's been said to me like 4 times now

- overall I just wouldn't recommend this location

It's simple. You have couple of things and you mix and match to make your own bowl/plate. The food is good. It's not crazy good that you would travel hundreds of kilometers but it's good. And it's not very expensive either. Try their homey golden shrimps that cost $1.25 extra but they were good. Take a plate and then enjoy a good conversation or not coz your mouth would be full of food....!

The crew, his name is Mourad, he’s really unkindly crew. I was waiting for first line. He told me wait 5 minutes. But other customer comes and they could order and purchase front on me. Mourad accepted cutting the line. Awful!! He never explained, never say sorry, also he gave me my order unkindly. I feel he is racist person. He ignored why I am Asian.

Okay food, staff seems kind of out of it, and they use delivery boxes.   Ordered a 2 Plate they give you a ton of rice or noodles and then two sides which are pretty small.  I think because of the boxes - if they used plates I think the portions would be larger.  Feel like I spent too much for too little shrimp and chicken and too much noodles.   Next time I am trying out one of the other Asian food places.

- food was good, seemed pretty fresh and had nice flavor.

- staff seemed friendly for the most part.

- service was quick.

- prices normal for the area.

- overall not bad, one of the better locations in the area.
Chipotle is a fast and easy meal... Burrito bowl was just perfect!  Good amount of all toppings.   I made the mistake of asking for red sauce - it was a bit hot.
$22 for tacos and chips & guac... just to give me the wrong order. First guy put in the wrong meat, cashier put in the wrong order in my bag. Didn't notice till I got home.  Never again.
I was very pleased with this restaurant they have many many things and options even for people that are vegetarian and I recommend it to others the managers are very friendly too
The service was too slow. I waited for 40 minutes for 3 bowls. And they didn't make the right order. They messed up my order. So eventually, we had to throw it out.
